description: Defines the ZerodhaBroker class implementing broker interface for Zerodha trading platform, including methods for order placement, retrieving positions, and profile information.

classes.name: ZerodhaBroker
classes.description: A stub implementation mimicking Zerodha trading platform integration points, with methods for order placement, fetching positions, and profile info.

methods.name: __init__(self, api_key: Optional[str], api_secret: Optional[str], access_token: Optional[str])
methods.description: Initializes a ZerodhaBroker instance with API credentials and access token.

methods.name: bool _connected(self)
methods.description: Checks if the broker is connected by verifying presence of API credentials and access token.

methods.name: OrderResponse place_order(self, symbol: str, side: str, qty: int, price: float | None = None)
methods.description: Submits an order, returns an OrderResponse, rejects if not connected.

methods.name: list[dict] get_positions(self)
methods.description: Returns current positions; returns empty list if not connected.

methods.name: dict get_profile(self)
methods.description: Returns the broker profile status including connection state.

ctags.name: __init__
ctags.pattern: /^    def __init__(self, api_key: Optional[str], api_secret: Optional[str], access_token: Optional/
ctags.signature: (self, api_key: Optional[str], api_secret: Optional[str], access_token: Optional[str])

ctags.name: place_order
ctags.pattern: /^    def place_order(self, symbol: str, side: str, qty: int, price: float | None = None) -> Order/
ctags.signature: (self, symbol: str, side: str, qty: int, price: float | None = None)
